title: Thiruchitrambalam
text:
Thiruchitrambalam is an upcoming Indian <a href="Tamil%20language">Tamil</a>-language <a href="romantic%20comedy">romantic comedy</a> film written and directed by <a href="Mithran%20Jawahar">Mithran Jawahar</a>. The film is produced by <a href="Kalanithi%20Maran">Kalanithi Maran</a> under the banner <a href="Sun%20Pictures">Sun Pictures</a>. The film stars <a href="Dhanush">Dhanush</a> in lead role with <a href="Raashi%20Khanna">Raashi Khanna</a>, <a href="Nithya%20Menen">Nithya Menen</a>, <a href="Priya%20Bhavani%20Shankar">Priya Bhavani Shankar</a>, <a href="Prakash%20Raj">Prakash Raj</a> and <a href="Bharathiraja">Bharathiraja</a> in supporting roles. The film's music and score is composed by <a href="Anirudh%20Ravichander">Anirudh Ravichander</a>, with cinematography handled by <a href="Om%20Prakash%20%28cinematographer%29">Om Prakash</a> and editing done by <a href="Prasanna%20GK">Prasanna GK</a>.
Production.
In early 2021, the production company <a href="Sun%20Pictures">Sun Pictures</a> announced a new project with <a href="Dhanush">Dhanush</a>, with the tentative title "#D44" (the actor's 44th film in leading role). <a href="Mithran%20Jawahar">Mithran Jawahar</a> was roped in to direct the project and <a href="Anirudh%20Ravichander">Anirudh Ravichander</a> was announced as the music composer. The film marked Dhanush's fourth project with Mithran Jawahar after "<a href="Yaaradi%20Nee%20Mohini">Yaaradi Nee Mohini</a>" (2008), "<a href="Kutty%20%282010%20film%29">Kutty</a>" (2010) and "<a href="Uthamaputhiran%20%282010%20film%29">Uthamaputhiran</a>" (2010). Initially <a href="Hansika%20Motwani">Hansika Motwani</a> (who early team up with him for "<a href="Mappillai%20%282011%20film%29">Mappillai</a>") was rumoured as the female lead. Later <a href="Raashi%20Khanna">Raashi Khanna</a>, <a href="Nithya%20Menen">Nithya Menen</a> and <a href="Priya%20Bhavani%20Shankar">Priya Bhavani Shankar</a> were reported to play in the female lead roles, while <a href="Prakash%20Raj">Prakash Raj</a> and <a href="Bharathiraja">Bharathiraja</a> joined the film as a supporting role. The film was titled as "Thiruchitrambalam" and the principal photography began with a pooja ceremony in <a href="Chennai">Chennai</a> on 5 August 2021. On 10 August, Prakash Raj took a short break for surgery after he fractured his shoulder during the shooting. Raashi Khanna joined the film's sets in Chennai on 25 August. The crew went to film the song sequences in <a href="Pondicherry">Pondicherry</a> after the Chennai schedule being completed.In August Dhanush and Raashi Khanna's shooting photo were leaked and went viral on internet. In September, a dance video clip featuring Dhanush and Nithya Menen from the film's shooting spot was leaked and went viral. After 50 days of continuous shoot, it was reported that the makers wrapped the film's shoot in October 2021 and moved to post production.
Soundtrack.
The music is composed by <a href="Anirudh%20Ravichander">Anirudh Ravichander</a> who is working with <a href="Dhanush">Dhanush</a> after six years and for the fifth time, followed by "<a href="3%20%282012%20Indian%20film%29">3</a>" (2012), "<a href="Velaiilla%20Pattadhari">Velaiilla Pattadhari</a>" (2014), "<a href="Maari%20%28film%29">Maari</a>" (2015) and "<a href="Thanga%20Magan%20%282015%20film%29">Thanga Magan</a>" (2015), and his first collaboration with <a href="Mithran%20Jawahar">Mithran Jawahar</a>.
Release.
It is reported that the film is scheduled for release in March 2022.
Home Media.
The Satellite Rights of the film were bagged by <a href="Sun%20TV%20%28India%29">Sun TV</a> and the Streaming Rights of the film were acquired by <a href="Sun%20NXT">Sun NXT</a> and <a href="Netflix">Netflix</a> respectively.
